page.title: 03Beacon Lane,Kingswear.
page.content: Beacon Lane is about half a mile long. It follows the River Dart and overlooks the estuary on the Kingswear side.It is a very old road,dating back to Saxon times,and was part of the main road to Brixham. In 1765 the inland road to Brixham was improved and Beacon Lane became quiet and overgrown. The road takes its name from the beacon which guides ships into Dartmouth harbour. A new automatic beacon was built in 1980 to replace an old stone tower which had stood for a hundred years. Beacon Lane today is a very wealthy road. The first three houses near the church are small stone cottages,but the rest are large and expensive and all face the river. Many of these have been made into flats and some gardens have been used for modern houses.
